args: Happy Halloween, everyone!\nMake sure to have lots of fun today!
I'm pleased to see the party is proving\neven more successful than we anticipated.
And thanks for all your help getting ready,\nEdward. Make sure you have some fun\ntoday as well, all right?
You are most gracious, master. I believe\nI may take you up on that.
As I said: Trick or treat?
Now, if you won't be giving me a treat,\nthat means you don't mind if I play a trick\non you, correct?
Okay, hang on! I'm pretty sure I've got\nsomething prepared for this!
But of course. There are limits as to how\nfar a butler can go when playing practical\njokes on his master.
Oh wow, you really had me there.\nYou looked so serious!
Ah, but it was you who said you wanted\nme to enjoy myself, was it not?
But for now, I shall keep the practical\njoking to a moderate level and go\non patrol.
I didn't think there were any signs of\nfiends around, though.
Ah, but I am patrolling INSIDE the castle;\nwe've taken special pains to invite a\nnumber of our neighbors to the party.
It's not out of the realm of possibility that\nunsavory types could also weasel their\nway in amongst the guests.
That's a good point. I'll go with you.
Whatever do you mean? You are the host\nof this party, master.
Leave such trifling details to me and focus\ninstead on watching over the gathering as\nbefits a good host.
All right, then. I'll leave it to you.
Very good, master.\nHave a happy Halloween.
Bwa ha ha! ＂Happy Halloween...＂\nWhat a heapin' pile'a nonsense!
Oy, but it's thanks to all that hullabaloo\nthat we're here in the first place.
Now let's make with the stealin'! Grab\neverything what ain't nailed down and\nthen we'll slip out undetected.
My, my. It appears I was quite right to\ncome keep an eye on things.
Good evening, gentlemen! Did you get\nlost on the way to the privy, perchance?
This is not the venue for the party.
Jumpin' dragons! Ain't that the vampire\nwhat folks have been whisperin' about\nlately?! The one from the forest?!
D-don't be an idiot! Look at those clothes!\nThis guy's a castle butler, mark my words!
What's the big idea, scarin' us like that?!
Look here, Jeeves! We hate to interrupt\nwhile you're workin', but it's time for you\nto take a little nap!
Do you truly believe I am but a simple\nbutler?
H-hey, what's goin' on?! Where'd all this\nfog come from?!
Dammit! I can't see a thing!
Was that a bat? Wait just a minute...\nYa don't think that guy really is a vam—
Gya! I got a cold feelin' on the back\nof my neck!
OoooOOoOOooo... If you aim to steal from\nthis castle, I shall have to take something\nof suitable value in exchange.
EEEEEEEEEEK! HE'S A VAMPIRE!\nHE'S A VAMPIIIIIIRE!
Ah, Master {player_name}.\nWhat are you doing here?
The party should still be going on.
I was worried about you. And when I came\nto check up on things, I heard shrieks.
...Um, Edward? Who are these people,\nand why are they unconscious on the floor?
Merely some thieves who sought to use\nthe cover of the party to steal from the\ncastle, master.
Okay, but what did you DO to them?
Just a little trick. It IS Halloween, after all.
I gave them a little shock with the magical\ncontrivances—fog and bats—whipped up\nby Madam Althemia.
Combined with a touch of vampiric\nbehavior on my part, and we have\nthe sight you see before you.
And the shock surprised them so much\nthat they fainted?
Quite so. As a result, I managed to\nbring about a resolution without any\nunnecessary fighting.
Wow, you really know your stuff, Edward.\nThey didn't steal a single thing, either.
Protecting the castle is yet another of my\nduties as a butler...afteeer...aaaaalllll...
Edward?! You look like you're about to\nfall over! Are you okay?!
I... Yes. Please, do not trouble yourself.\nJust a light spell of dizziness. Nothing\nmore.
Now then! I shall dispose of these\nmiscreants outside the castle grounds.
Please return to the party, master.\nNow, if you will excuse me?
